Class Game

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameClient, GameServer
public class Game extends Object implements GameServer, GameClient
Represents a full game session, managing both server-side and client-side responsibilities.

This class implements both GameServer and GameClient, acting as the core container for the game state, players, event handling, and controller coordination.

On the server side, it handles player management, game setup, and lifecycle control. On the client side, it provides read-only access to game metadata such as mode and number of players.

This class is designed to be thread-safe for operations involving shared resources like the event queue.

    • Game

      public Game(int idGame)
      Constructs a new Game with the specified game ID. Initializes the GameController for the game. Defaults to non-testing mode.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The unique identifier of the game.

    • Game

      public Game(int idGame, boolean testing)
      Constructs a new Game with the specified game ID and testing mode.
      Parameters:
      idGame - the unique identifier of the game
      testing - true if the game is in testing mode; false otherwise

  • Method Details

    • setupGame

      public void setupGame(GameMode mode, int numPlayers)
      Initializes the game with the specified mode and number of players.

      This method also resets the creation flag in the GameManager singleton and notifies all threads waiting for the game to be created.

      Specified by:
      setupGame in interface GameClient
      Specified by:
      setupGame in interface GameServer
      Parameters:
      mode - the selected game mode
      numPlayers - the expected number of players

    • getClients

      public Map<String,VirtualClient> getClients()
      Returns a map of clients currently connected to this game, keyed by their nicknames. The returned map is synchronized.
      Specified by:
      getClients in interface GameServer
      Returns:
      A Map where keys are player nicknames (String) and values are VirtualClient instances.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game in a new thread once all players have joined.

      Initializes the FlyBoard, registers the event listeners, distributes initial game data to clients, and starts the hourglass timer.

      Specified by:
      startGame in interface GameServer
